refnamediv.refpurpose: Turns on or off auto-commiting database modifications

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mysqli_autocommit is used to turn on or off auto-commit mode on queries for the database connection represented by the link object.

note.para: mysqli_autocommit doesn't work with non transactional table types (like MyISAM or ISAM).
To determine the current state of autocommit use the SQL command 'SELECT @@autocommit'.

refsect1.title: Example

example.title: Object oriented style
example.programlisting:
<?php
$mysqli = new mysqli("localhost", "my_user", "my_password", "world");

if (mysqli_connect_errno()) {
    printf("Connect failed: %s\n", mysqli_connect_error());
    exit();
}

/* turn autocommit on */
$mysqli->autocommit(TRUE);

if ($result = $mysqli->query("SELECT @@autocommit")) {
    $row = $result->fetch_row();
    printf("Autocommit is %s\n", $row[0]);
    $result->free();
}

/* close connection */
$mysqli->close();
?>

example.title: Procedural style
example.programlisting:
<?php
$link = mysqli_connect("localhost", "my_user", "my_password", "world");

if (!$link) {
    printf("Can't connect to localhost. Error: %s\n", mysqli_connect_error());
    exit();
}

/* turn autocommit on */
mysqli_autocommit($link, TRUE);

if ($result = mysqli_query($link, "SELECT @@autocommit")) {
    $row = mysqli_fetch_row($result);
    printf("Autocommit is %s\n", $row[0]);
    mysqli_free_result($result);
}

/* close connection */
mysqli_close($link);
?>
